history.text: I thought it was a great animated film. What do you think?
I agree! I think the characters are voiced well, especially Steve Carrell as Gru!
That he was. Russel Brand was great too.
I didn't even realize Rusell Branch voiced Dr. Nefario! What a great surprise! Or Jason Segel as Vector. Might have to re-watch the movie because I love Jason Segel.
I thought the movie was definitely amusing and very original
I agree. I loved how it had something for both kids and adults in it. Makes watching it as a family easier.
Exactly! There was the perfect "sweet-and-sour" blend and the dirty jokes went right over kids heads'!
Do you think Rotten Tomatoes rated it too low?
Pixar has always been really good at that.
No, I think that's a pretty good rating. Anything over 70% usually means it was good.
It wasn't mind blowing or anything. Just good, clean fun.
That's true and I agree with that!
What did you think of the Minions?
They're kind of the secret stars of the movie. Probably why they got their own spin off.
Though they can be over-used sometimes.
You a Pharrell fan?
I agree - they made the movie a lot more enjoyable for me but the entire nation craze after that was excessive. I thougt the Great Pyramids scene was fun. And lol that song probably drove me nuts!

I think it's interesting this was the directors'
 first film together.
Usually a team like that is well-established.
Definitely, it came together really well
I think some of my favorite scenes are when he starts to warm up to the girls
Yeah, it wasn't laugh out loud funny, but I found myself amused throughout.
That was a good scene.
I thought the girls offering their piggy bank was such a sweet and pivotal moment
That was definitely nice. But I'm sorry, I gotta admit, it's all about Pharrell. It's always been about Pharrell.
And the ballet recital being on the same day as he needs to carry-out the plan created a good big of drama.
Hahaha the man who never ages
And that hat. The plot does get a bit crazy towards the end though. Everything is so dense, there's so much going on.
But it's not overwhelming and yup, his hat got its own twitter account
I liked how the shrink ray affect was temporary!
Fortunate, that. It reminded me of the Rick Moranis classic, Honey I Shrunk the Kids.
Oh, I can totally see that! I wonder if they had any inspiration from that
I felt it had some inspiration from movies past. It's strange, but it also had a French feel to it. I was surprised to learn that it was animated by a French studio.
Which critical response do you agree with the most?
Hmm, interesting! I didn't do that much research on the movie!
Metacritic. It's a totally passable movie. Enjoyable, but not ground breaking.

Well, it was great talking with you! Have a 
good one!

uid1response.feedback: The other user got a little off topic at times
